intro: Muelleranthus parvalatus, commonly known as the small muelleria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
